reasoning: Thyroid nodules measured as prevalence (~2.5% in general population by palpation, higher by ultrasound ~16-50%). Using conservative 2.5% estimate (2,500 per 100k) based on clinical palpation studies; ultrasound-detected prevalence much higher but variable.
source: Tunbridge WM et al. (1981). The spectrum of thyroid disease in a community: the Whickham Survey. Clin Endocrinol. 7(6):481-493; WHO epidemiological data
